value.title: Create Hierarchy Slicer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we will learn, how we can create a Hierarchy Slicer in Power BI Desktop. Microsoft recently introduced Hierarchy Slicer as a part of the OOTB slicers.  In this video, we will learn how to create a hierarchy slicer using OOTB slicer option. Also, we will check the different formatting properties

value.title: 5 ways to get Power BI Support #pbifamily

value.title: Avoid Left Outer Joins with DirectQuery in Power BI
value.excerpt: By default, your DirectQuery queries, in Power BI, will send a LEFT OUTER JOIN and could make your DBA not happy! Patrick shows you how you can change this to an INNER JOIN and put your DBA back into that happy space.  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want

value.title: Azure Active Directory and Power BI
value.excerpt: I take a look at how Power BI and Azure Active Directory interact.  Really it is more about Azure Active Directory and how do you get users into AAD. value.title: Configure data sources for Power BI Reports in Power BI Report Server
value.excerpt: In this video, I show you how you can configure the data source of a Power BI report within Power BI Report Server. value.title: Configure Kerberos for Power BI reports in Reporting Services
value.excerpt: I walk through how to configure Kerberos to get Power BI reports within SQL Server Reporting Services running in a distributed environment. value.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to use conditional columns within Power Query and then copying them for use in other queries or Power BI Desktop files. This is a great technique if you don't want to retype all of the conditional items in the dialog in Power BI.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Do we need more Power BI Premium Capacity?
value.excerpt: Capacity planning for Power BI Premium is not an exact science. How much capacity do you need? As with most things, it depends! Adam walks through some things to consider when thinking about your planning.  Premium Gen2 capacity load evaluation https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-concepts
